A Prayer of David. Hear the right, O LORD, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, <FI>that goeth<Fi> not out of feigned lips.<RF>the right: Heb. justice<Rf><RF>not…: Heb. without lips of deceit<Rf>
Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.
Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited <FI>me<Fi> in the night; thou hast tried me, <FI>and<Fi> shalt find nothing; I am purposed <FI>that<Fi> my mouth shall not transgress.
Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept <FI>me from<Fi> the paths of the destroyer.
Hold up my goings in thy paths, <FI>that<Fi> my footsteps slip not.<RF>slip…: Heb. be not moved<Rf>
I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, <FI>and hear<Fi> my speech.

Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust <FI>in thee<Fi> from those that rise up <FI>against them<Fi>.<RF>by thy…: or, them which trust in thee from those that rise up against thy right hand<Rf><CM>
Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings,
From the wicked that oppress me, <FI>from<Fi> my deadly enemies, <FI>who<Fi> compass me about.<RF>oppress: Heb. waste<Rf><RF>my…: Heb. my enemies against the soul<Rf>
They are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.
They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;

Like as a lion <FI>that<Fi> is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.<RF>Like…: Heb. The likeness of him (that is, of every one of them) is as a lion that desireth to ravin<Rf><RF>lurking: Heb. sitting<Rf>
Arise, O LORD, disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, <FI>which is<Fi> thy sword:<RF>disappoint…: Heb. prevent his face<Rf><RF>which is: or, by<Rf>

From men <FI>which are<Fi> thy hand, O LORD, from men of the world, <FI>which have<Fi> their portion in <FI>this<Fi> life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid <FI>treasure<Fi>: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their <FI>substance<Fi> to their babes.<RF>which are: or, by<Rf><RF>they…: or, their children are full<Rf>
As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.<CM>
